body:
Use this service as part of a procurement process of 3rd party content you are looking to use (not 3rd party content you use already). This will help you gauge your responsibilities before making a commitment.

## Legal disclaimer

The suggestions given are exactly that and do not constitute legal guidance. You should seek legal advice and complete all due diligence to ensure you are properly aware of any responsibilities you hold when procuring 3rd party products.

Please refer to [Public Sector Bodies (Websites and Mobile Applications) Accessibility Regulations 2018](https://www.legislation.gov.uk/uksi/2018/852/contents/made).
foo:
## Accessibility first

You should try and get accessible stuff. If you do, it's

- good for the users
-  you don't have to worry about the responsibility
heading: Determine whether you have responsibility for accessibility of 3rd party content
